Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-grey pottery wine-jar, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/842 The North Suburb, The South Western Quarter, House T.36.10.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393486) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393486)
